proscene
Class PSQuaternion

java.lang.Object
  proscene.PSQuaternion

public class PSQuaternion
extends java.lang.Object

A 4 element unit quaternion represented by single precision floating point x,y,z,w coordinates.

Field Summary
 float w
          The w coordinate which corresponds to the scalar part of the PSQuaternion.
 float x
          The x coordinate, i.e., the x coordinate of the vector part of the PSQuaternion.
 float y
          The y coordinate, i.e., the y coordinate of the vector part of the PSQuaternion.
 float z
          The z coordinate, i.e., the z coordinate of the vector part of the PSQuaternion.

PSQuaternion

public PSQuaternion(float x,
                    float y,
                    float z,
                    float w,
                    boolean normalize)
Constructs and initializes a PSQuaternion from the specified xyzw coordinates.

Parameters:
x - the x coordinate
y - the y coordinate
z - the z coordinate
w - the w scalar component
normalize - tells whether or not the constructed PSQuaternion should be normalized.

negate

public final void negate()
Negates all the coefficients of the PSQuaternion.

dotProduct

public final float dotProduct(PSQuaternion b)
Returns the "dot" product of this PSQuaternion and b:

this.x * b.x + this.y * b.y + this.z * b.z + this.w * b.w

Parameters:
b - the PSQuaternion

dotProduct

public static final float dotProduct(PSQuaternion a,
                                     PSQuaternion b)
Returns the "dot" product of a and b:

a.x * b.x + a.y * b.y + a.z * b.z + a.w * b.w

Parameters:
a - the first PSQuaternion
b - the second PSQuaternion

q1 - the other PSQuaternion

Parameters:
v - the PVector

                                                     processing.core.PVector v)

Parameters:
q1 - the PSQuaternion
v - the PVector
See Also:
rotate(PVector), inverseRotate(PVector)

multiplyInverse

public final void multiplyInverse(PSQuaternion q1)
Multiplies this PSQuaternion by the inverse of PSQuaternion q1 and places the value into this PSQuaternion (i.e., this = this * q^-1). The value of the argument PSQuaternion is preserved.

Parameters:
q1 - the other PSQuaternion

multiplyInverse

public static final PSQuaternion multiplyInverse(PSQuaternion q1,
                                                 PSQuaternion q2)
Returns the product of PSQuaternion q1 by the inverse of PSQuaternion q2 (i.e., q1 * q2^-1). The value of both argument quaternions is preserved.

Parameters:
q1 - the first PSQuaternion
q2 - the second PSQuaternion

inverse

public final PSQuaternion inverse()
Returns the inverse PSQuaternion (inverse rotation).

The result has a negated axis() direction and the same angle().

A composition of a PSQuaternion and its inverse() results in an identity function. Use invert() to actually modify the PSQuaternion.

See Also:
invert()

invert

public final void invert()
Sets the value of this PSQuaternion to the inverse of itself.

See Also:
inverse()

invert

public final void invert(PSQuaternion q1)
Sets the value of this PSQuaternion to the PSQuaternion inverse of q1.

Parameters:
q1 - the PSQuaternion to be inverted

normalize

public final float normalize()
Normalizes the value of this PSQuaternion in place and return its norm.

rotate

public final processing.core.PVector rotate(processing.core.PVector v)
Returns the image of v by the PSQuaternion rotation.

Parameters:
v - the PVector

inverseRotate

public final processing.core.PVector inverseRotate(processing.core.PVector v)
Returns the image of v by the PSQuaternion inverse() rotation.

rotate(PVector) performs an inverse transformation.

Parameters:
v - the PVector

fromAxisAngle

public void fromAxisAngle(processing.core.PVector axis,
                          float angle)
Sets the PSQuaternion as a rotation of axis and angle (in radians).

The axis does not need to be normalized. A null axis will result in an identity PSQuaternion.

Parameters:
axis - the PVector representing the axis
angle - the angle in radians

fromTo

public void fromTo(processing.core.PVector from,
                   processing.core.PVector to)
Sets the PSQuaternion as a rotation from the from direction to the to direction.

Attention: this rotation is not uniquely defined. The selected axis is usually orthogonal to from and to, minimizing the rotation angle. This method is robust and can handle small or almost identical vectors.

See Also:
fromAxisAngle(PVector, float)

fromRotationMatrix

public final void fromRotationMatrix(float[][] m)
Set the PSQuaternion from a (supposedly correct) 3x3 rotation matrix.

The matrix is expressed in European format: its three columns are the images by the rotation of the three vectors of an orthogonal basis.

fromRotatedBasis(PVector, PVector, PVector) sets a PSQuaternion from the three axis of a rotated frame. It actually fills the three columns of a matrix with these rotated basis vectors and calls this method.

Parameters:
m - the 3*3 matrix of float values

fromMatrix

public final void fromMatrix(processing.core.PMatrix3D pM)
Set the PSQuaternion from a (supposedly correct) 3x3 rotation matrix given in the upper left 3x3 sub-matrix of the PMatrix3D.

See Also:
fromRotationMatrix(float[][])

fromRotatedBasis

public final void fromRotatedBasis(processing.core.PVector X,
                                   processing.core.PVector Y,
                                   processing.core.PVector Z)
Sets the PSQuaternion from the three rotated vectors of an orthogonal basis.

The three vectors do not have to be normalized but must be orthogonal and direct (i,e., X^Y=k*Z, with k>0).

Parameters:
X - the first PVector
Y - the second PVector
Z - the third PVector
See Also:
fromRotationMatrix(float[][]), PSQuaternion(PVector, PVector)

axis

public final processing.core.PVector axis()
Returns the normalized axis direction of the rotation represented by the PSQuaternion.

The result is null for an identity PSQuaternion.

See Also:
angle()

angle

public final float angle()
Returns the angle (in radians) of the rotation represented by the PSQuaternion.

This value is always in the range [0-pi]. Larger rotational angles are obtained by inverting the axis() direction.

See Also:
axis()

rotationMatrix

public final float[][] rotationMatrix()
Returns the 3x3 rotation matrix associated with the PSQuaternion.

Attention: The method returns the European mathematical representation of the rotation matrix.

See Also:
inverseRotationMatrix()

matrix

public final processing.core.PMatrix3D matrix()
Returns the PMatrix3D (processing matrix) which represents the rotation matrix associated with the PSQuaternion.

See Also:
rotationMatrix()

inverseMatrix

public final processing.core.PMatrix3D inverseMatrix()
Returns the associated inverse rotation processing PMatrix3D. This is simply matrix() of the inverse().

Attention: The result is only valid until the next call to inverseMatrix(). Use it immediately (as in applyMatrix(q.inverseMatrix())).

inverseRotationMatrix

public final float[][] inverseRotationMatrix()
Returns the 3x3 inverse rotation matrix associated with the PSQuaternion.

Attention: This is the classical mathematical rotation matrix.

log

public final PSQuaternion log()
Returns the logarithm of the PSQuaternion.

See Also:
exp()

exp

public final PSQuaternion exp()
Returns the exponential of the PSQuaternion.

See Also:
log()

randomQuaternion

public static final PSQuaternion randomQuaternion()
Returns a random unit PSQuaternion.

You can create a randomly directed unit vector using:

PVector randomDir = new PVector(1.0f, 0.0f, 0.0f);
randomDir = PSQuaternion.multiply(PSQuaternion.randomQuaternion(), randomDir);

slerp

public static final PSQuaternion slerp(PSQuaternion a,
                                       PSQuaternion b,
                                       float t)
Wrapper function that simply calls slerp(a, b, t, true).

See slerp(PSQuaternion, PSQuaternion, float, boolean) for details.

slerp

public static final PSQuaternion slerp(PSQuaternion a,
                                       PSQuaternion b,
                                       float t,
                                       boolean allowFlip)
Returns the slerp interpolation of quaternions a and b, at time t.

t should range in [0,1]. Result is a when t=0 and b when t=1.

When allowFlip is true (default) the slerp interpolation will always use the "shortest path" between the quaternions' orientations, by "flipping" the source PSQuaternion if needed (see negate()).

Parameters:
a - the first PSQuaternion
b - the second PSQuaternion
t - the t interpolation parameter
allowFlip - tells whether or not the interpolation allows axis flip

squad

public static final PSQuaternion squad(PSQuaternion a,
                                       PSQuaternion tgA,
                                       PSQuaternion tgB,
                                       PSQuaternion b,
                                       float t)
Returns the slerp interpolation of the two quaternions a and b, at time t, using tangents tgA and tgB.

The resulting PSQuaternion is "between" a and b (result is a when t=0 and b for t=1).

Use squadTangent(PSQuaternion, PSQuaternion, PSQuaternion) to define the PSQuaternion tangents tgA and tgB.

Parameters:
a - the first PSQuaternion
tgA - the first tangent PSQuaternion
tgB - the second tangent PSQuaternion
b - the second PSQuaternion
t - the t interpolation parameter

lnDif

public static final PSQuaternion lnDif(PSQuaternion a,
                                       PSQuaternion b)
Simply returns log(a. inverse() * b).

Useful for squadTangent(PSQuaternion, PSQuaternion, PSQuaternion).

Parameters:
a - the first PSQuaternion
b - the second PSQuaternion

squadTangent

public static final PSQuaternion squadTangent(PSQuaternion before,
                                              PSQuaternion center,
                                              PSQuaternion after)
Returns a tangent PSQuaternion for center, defined by before and after quaternions.

Parameters:
before - the first PSQuaternion
center - the second PSQuaternion
after - the third PSQuaternion

squaredNorm

public static float squaredNorm(PSQuaternion q)
Utility function that returns the squared norm of the PSQuaternion.
